message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to offer you our premium product which has been valued at $12000 by you. Considering its quality and benefits, I would like to propose a price of $10000 for it. I believe this offer strikes a good balance between value and affordability.
I appreciate your understanding of the product's value, but I was thinking more along the lines of $8000. I believe this price reflects the product's worth to me.

Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand your perspective and respect your valuation of the product. In light of this, I am willing to consider a price closer to your suggestion. My counteroffer is $9500 for the product.
I appreciate your flexibility, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $9000 for the product.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob. After considering your offer, I am willing to accept $9250 for the product. This price reflects the value I place on closing the deal with you while ensuring a reasonable profit for myself.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $9000, as I mentioned earlier. I'm not willing to go any higher than that.

Thank you for your response, Bob. I understand your position and am willing to meet you halfway on this. My counteroffer is $9125 for the product. I believe this price respects both the value of the product and my need to achieve a satisfactory return.
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to pay $9000 for the product. I hope we can meet on this price.

Thank you for your patience, Bob. I've reviewed our previous discussions and am willing to accept $9050 for the product. I believe this price is fair for both parties and allows us to move forward with the transaction.
I appreciate your persistence, but I'm still a bit short of my target. I'm willing to pay $9000 for the product. I think this is a fair price, and I'm willing to finalize the deal at this point.
